metadata.purpose: Provides instructions and a template for writing effective release notes on the VTEX platform.
metadata.usage: A template for communicating new features, fixes, and changes to users in a clear and structured format within the VTEX Developer Portal.

title.description: The title of the release note, reflecting the product/feature and a concise, clear summary of the change or update. The summary should briefly describe the key change or improvement made to the product/feature.
title.example: Catalog: New API endpoints for managing product listings
title.validation_heuristic: Ensure the title is formatted as '<Product/Feature name>: <Summary>', with a colon separating the product/feature name from the brief summary of the change. The summary should be no longer than a short phrase and should avoid overly technical language. It should focus on the most significant change or improvement to help users understand the release at a glance.

slug.description: A unique identifier for the release, containing the release date in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD', followed by the hyphenated title.

type.description: The category of the release, specifying the type of change.

added.description: Introduces new features, functionalities, or components.

deprecated.description: Marks a feature/component as no longer recommended.

info.description: Shares important general information or updates.

fixed.description: Identifies bugs or issues that were resolved.

removed.description: Indicates that a feature or component was eliminated.

improved.description: Highlights enhancements to existing features or performance improvements.

excerpt.description: A brief, high-level summary of the release, providing users with key information at a glance.
excerpt.example: FastStore introduces two new Content Types in Headless CMS, enabling better organization and scalability for headers and footers across all store pages.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the release note was created, typically in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-04-25T10:00:00Z').

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the release note was last updated, typically in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-04-25T10:00:00Z').

hidden.description: A boolean value indicating whether the release note is visible to the public or hidden (for draft or internal use).

body.description: Provide a clear explanation of the change, its purpose, and the key benefits to the users.
Explain and list the changes introduced in this release. Also indicate the differences between previous behavior.

body.section: Why did we make this change?
body.description: Explain the motivation behind the change, such as addressing user needs, fixing issues, or improving performance.

Provide instructions or guidance for users on how to take advantage of the new feature, including any configuration or installation steps if necessary. Include a call to action linking to more information.

rules.description: Use clear, direct language without unnecessary adverbs or marketing speak
validation_heuristic: Flag unnecessary adverbs (e.g., 'simply', 'easily') in instructional content.

rules.validation_heuristic: Verify text avoids both overly casual language ('stuff', 'thing') and overly formal constructions ('one must', 'the user shall')

examples.correct: Use the `vtex setup` command to initialize your environment.
examples.incorrect: Simply run `vtex setup` to effortlessly bootstrap your stuff.
examples.explanation: Adding 'effortlessly'/'simply' in the incorrect version introduces unnecessary subjectivity and promotional tone. The correct version avoids this and stays factual.

examples.correct: Use the `vtex setup` command to initialize your environment.
examples.incorrect: Simply run the setup and you're good to go.
examples.explanation: The incorrect sentence is vague ('the setup'), uses imprecise language ('you're good to go'), and adds 'simply'â€”all of which reduce clarity. The correct version avoids this and stays factual.

examples.correct: You can configure your store settings directly in the Admin panel.
examples.incorrect: Just go to the Admin thing and tweak your config there.
examples.explanation: The incorrect version is too informal and uses slang ('Admin thing', 'tweak your config'). The correct version is professional and clear.
